critique: This document is an executive order that consolidates several district land offices into single offices or into the Bureau of Land Management in Washington D.C. It does not seem to have any strong ideological leaning, nor does it touch on immigration, executive power, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The only axis that it seems to affect is federalism, as it centralizes the land offices into a single office in Portland, Oregon, and consolidates two more into the Bureau of Land Management in Washington D.C. This indicates a shift towards federal control.
